original_title: Sri Lanka party leaders to meet amid debt plan expectations
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s party leaders are to meet on June 27 amid expectations of debt restructuring plan being unveiled in parliament, political sources said.
Sri Lanka declared a special bank holiday on Friday, with Thursday (Hajj) and Monday (Poya day) also holidays, giving rise to speculation that a debt restructuring plan will be made public next week.

There is a strong likelihood that the plan will go to cabinet next week and be debated at a special session of parliament on July 01 and 02, after going through the required parliamentary processes, sources said.

The debt restructuring strategy, which involves restructuring rupee bonds as well as bilateral and private debt was originally due to be made public in April but has been delayed as authorities continued to analyze possible restructuring options.
Authorities have tried out possible domestic debt restructuring combinations to reduce or avoid a hit on the banking system, according to analysts.
SriLanka authorities were due to meet private and bilateral creditors this week in Paris. (Colombo/June24/2023)
